cluster_classes.class_description: Social groups of rural inhabitants (peasants and villagers) who served as primary sources for the Grimm brothers' collected tales.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: gathering stories from peasants and villagers to preserve the oral traditions

members.entity_description: Rural, lower-class inhabitants of the German countryside who shared oral stories with the Grimms.
Residents of small rural settlements in Germany who recounted tales to the Grimm brothers.

remarks: This parent class is now mostly a fallback for unspecified rural informants after splitting out peasants and villagers; consider deprecating if it remains empty.

cluster_classes.class_description: Rural areas within Germany that serve as cultural and geographical settings, such as those traveled by the Brothers Grimm to collect folk stories.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: traveled throughout the German countryside, gathering stories from peasants and villagers

members.entity_description: Rural regions of Germany where the Grimm brothers traveled to collect stories.

splits.name: German Peasants (Grimm Sources)
splits.description: Rural, lower-class inhabitants of the German countryside who shared oral stories with the Brothers Grimm.

splits.name: German Villagers (Grimm Sources)
splits.description: Residents of small rural settlements in Germany who recounted tales to the Brothers Grimm.

args.justification: The original 'Rural Social Groups' class bundles two distinct but related social groups—peasants and villagers—which are each meaningful and separately referenced sources for Grimm tales; splitting improves semantic coherence and granularity.

args.new_description: Rural, lower-class inhabitants of the German countryside who shared oral stories with the Brothers Grimm.
args.new_class_group: Grimm Brothers Folk Tale Collection – Rural German Context
args.justification: Aligns the new peasants class with a shared class group capturing the rural German context of Grimm fieldwork and ensures consistent metadata.

args.new_description: Residents of small rural settlements in Germany who recounted tales to the Brothers Grimm.
args.new_class_group: Grimm Brothers Folk Tale Collection – Rural German Context
args.justification: Places the new villagers class in the same higher-level grouping as related social and geographical context classes for Grimm tale collection.

args.new_description: Rural inhabitants who served as informants for the Brothers Grimm when not otherwise specified as peasants or villagers.
args.new_class_group: Grimm Brothers Folk Tale Collection – Rural German Context
args.remark: This parent class is now mostly a fallback for unspecified rural informants after splitting out peasants and villagers; consider deprecating if it remains empty.
args.justification: Renames and aligns the residual class to reflect its new, narrower role after splitting and to share the common rural Grimm context group.

args.new_description: Rural areas within Germany that served as cultural and geographical settings for the Brothers Grimm as they traveled to collect folk stories.
args.new_class_group: Grimm Brothers Folk Tale Collection – Rural German Context
args.justification: Connects the geographic rural regions class to the same higher-level grouping as the rural social groups, reflecting their shared role in the Grimm collection context.

executed_decisions.justification: The original 'Rural Social Groups' class bundles two distinct but related social groups—peasants and villagers—which are each meaningful and separately referenced sources for Grimm tales; splitting improves semantic coherence and granularity.
